tool.name: Generate muonated structures (pm-muairss)
tool.command: ln -s $structure input.cell && ln -s $params params.yaml && #if str($iscastep.iscastep_sel)=="true": ln -s $castep_param $castep_param.name && sed -i '/^castep_param: /{h;s/:.*/: $castep_param.name/};\${x;/^$/{s//castep_param: $castep_param.name/;H};x}' params.yaml && #end if pm-muairss -t w input.cell params.yaml && out_folder="`python ${__tool_directory__}/get_out_folder.py`" && #if str($iscastep.iscastep_sel)=="true": zip -r out_zip.zip \$out_folder params.yaml input.cell $castep_param.name && #else if str($iscastep.iscastep_sel)=="false": zip -r out_zip.zip \$out_folder params.yaml input.cell && #end if #if $testing=="true" and str($iscastep.iscastep_sel)=="true": grep -o "castep_param" params.yaml | wc -l > tree.txt && #else if $testing=="true" and str($iscastep.iscastep_sel)=="false": grep -o "name" params.yaml | wc -l > tree.txt && #end if find \$out_folder >> tree.txt

param.name: structure
param.label: Structure file
param.help: The structure to add muons to. The original file will be preserved. Accepted file types: cell.

param.name: params
param.label: YAML parameter file
param.help: YAML parameters for this and subsequent tools. You can create this file using the [YAML config generator] tool.

param.name: iscastep_sel
param.label: Does your configuration use the CASTEP calculator?
param.help: Select 'Yes' if the 'calculator' parameter is set to 'castep' in your chosen YAML file (not case sensitive).

param.name: castep_param
param.label: CASTEP parameter file
param.help: CASTEP parameters (.param file) for the optimisation stage. These parameters will be copied for each muonated structure.

tool.help:
Given an input structure, this tool generates a set of duplicate structures, each with a single muon added in a random location.
The YAML file controls many factors of the structure generation. We recommend using the '`YAML config generator`_' tool to create the file, but you can also write and upload it yourself following the `pm-muairss documentation`_.
The resulting structures will be returned as a zip folder. This zip folder can be used as input for the '`Generate UEP outputs`_' tool, or downloaded for use outside Galaxy.
Command-line usage: pm-muairss -t w structure_file parameter_file
.. _pm-muairss documentation: https://github.com/muon-spectroscopy-computational-project/pymuon-suite/blob/master/docs/muairss-gen-docs.md .. _YAML config generator: http://localhost:9090/tool_runner?tool_id=pm_uep_opt_write .. _Generate UEP outputs: http://localhost:9090/tool_runner?tool_id=pm_uep_opt_write
